void CodeEditorWidget::NewScriptFile ( ) [slot]

Creates a new empty script.

Before creates the new scripts, it verifies if the current script can be closed.

bool CodeEditorWidget::OkToContinue ( )

Returns true if the application is ready to start with other script. Otherwise, returns false.

Definition at line 88 of file CodeEditorWidget.cpp.

void CodeEditorWidget::OpenScriptFile ( ) [slot]

Opens a script file into the script editor and sets this file as current file.

A dialog is created to select an existing script file.

Before open the selected script, it verifies if the current script can be closed.

bool CodeEditorWidget::SaveAsScriptFile ( ) [private, slot]

Returns true if script is correctly saved. Otherwise, returns false. A file dialog is created to select a file.

See also:
SaveScriptFile, SaveFile.

Definition at line 179 of file CodeEditorWidget.cpp.

References SaveScriptFile().

Referenced by SaveScript(), and SetupToolbar().

bool CodeEditorWidget::SaveScript ( ) [private, slot]

Saves the editor code in the file defined as current. If a current file is not defined, it calls to SaveAsScriptFile to define a current file.

See also:
SaveScriptFile, SaveAsScriptFile.

bool CodeEditorWidget::SaveScriptFile ( const QString &  fileName) [private]
